doc.repnme: Avances latinoamericanos en la gestion de los servicios de agua y saneamiento
doc.abstracts: This report summarizes the proceedings of a workshop on advances in the management of water and sanitation services in Latin America. The objective of the symposium was to improve the provision of water and sanitation services to small towns in Latin America, and elevate the quality of life of its inhabitants. Specifically, the workshop had these objectives: share the lessons learned in Pilot Project for Small Towns (PPPL) and the National Rural Sanitation and Potable Water Program (PRONASAR) in the different countries of the region; exchange experiences acquired in the process of reform, creating new management models and the construction of new regulatory and institutional frameworks; and identify common success stories from the reforms.
